intro: Lespedeza pampaninii, commonly known as the Panamá lespedeza, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Central America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It is known for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility. Lespedeza pampaninii is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its hardy nature and adaptability.
